page.title: 13PARACHUTING - THE CONFLICT
page.content:
The disturbance from aircraft used by the parachutists has caused considerable conflict amongst the local people in recent years. It has led to two public enquiries where an active group of concerned locals have sought to prevent the parachutists from having legal planning permission to use the airfield. At the second enquiry, a compromise was reached, allowing a more limited number of jumps to take place. These are restricted to Wednesdays and week-ends.
The effect of this legal battle on the local community has been quite marked. Many have said that the experience of neighbour standing against neighbour in the courtroom is one which will not be forgotten easily.
